intro: Cheilanthes reesii, commonly known as the Rees' rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a terrestrial fern that typically grows in rocky or crevice habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with dense, compact clusters of dark green, leathery leaves. Its fronds are usually small and closely spaced, with a distinctive, rounded shape. Cheilanthes reesii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
